thread.section_title: WSJ Life, Style & Arts: Weekend News and Reads
thread.title: ‘The Feather Thief’ Review: A Fuss Over Feathers

author: Tom Nolan
title: ‘The Feather Thief’ Review: A Fuss Over Feathers
text:
Housed in the Natural History Museum at Tring, Hertfordshire, about an hour northwest of London, is one of the greatest collections of ornithological specimens on the planet. Here are kept the skeletons and skins of such extinct species as the Dodo and the Great Auk, along with the finches gathered by Charles Darwin on his expedition aboard HMS Beagle in the 1830s and a wealth of rare and colorful birds brought back from distant lands by Darwin’s contemporary, the naturalist Alfred Russel Wallace.
On a June evening in 2009,...
